page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: The soil is quite chalky and flinty because we are so near to the Chilterns. There are 8 farms in our area;Lord and Lady Macclesfield's estate and Model Farm which belongs to their son (at Shirburn), Home Farm (Pyrton), Knightsbridge Farm and Stokefield Farm to the West of Lewknor and Field Farm, Church Farm and Town Farm in Lewknor. They are all quite small, mainly arable farms with some pasture supporting dairy herds (Friesian). The most common crops grown are; wheat, barley and oats. There is an agricultural machinery supplier, Farrels, in Lewknor. The machines used are;combine harvesters, trctors, bailers, silage trailers, harrows, ploughs and forage choppers.
